definition: trouble/disturbance/rumpus/flirty/coquettish/abbr. for 離騷|离骚[Li2 Sao1]/literary writings/smell of urine/foul smell/male (animal) (dialect)
lit. belly full of complaints (idiom)/discontent/always moaning and complaining

sentences.english: We closed our ears to their complaints.
sentences.chinese: 我们不理睬他们的牢骚。

sentences.english: Her long hair is often plained.
But what if you’re feeling grouchy?
sentences.chinese: 如果你自己都满腹牢骚情况会怎么样呢？

sentences.english: This is the third time the tourists squawked about the service of the hotel.
sentences.chinese: 这是旅客们第三次对饭店的服务发牢骚了。

sentences.english: He is forever croaking about his problems .
sentences.chinese: 他老是为他那些问题发牢骚。

sentences.english: Her incessant whining drives me crazy.
Could you go without griping about anything for a day?
sentences.chinese: 你能不能一整天都不发一句牢骚？

sentences.english: Do you have the time, To listen to me whine.
sentences.chinese: 你有时间，来听我发牢骚吗。

sentences.english: You don’t like it here, don’t fuck so much next time.
sentences.chinese: 如果不喜欢这里，就别他妈的在这里发牢骚。

sentences.english: Go on, go on, ILove to hear you whine.
sentences.chinese: 继续说啊，我喜欢听你发牢骚。

sentences.english: I’m really bored with his sitting there doing nothing but beefing.
sentences.chinese: 他坐在那里什么事也不干，总是发牢骚，真烦死人。

sentences.english: For my dream i will grin and bear it, without complaint.
sentences.chinese: 为了这个梦想我要任劳任怨不再满腹牢骚。

sentences.english: I wish he'd stop belly-aching about his children's behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 我希望他不要再为孩子们的行为发牢骚了。

sentences.english: Just under one third said grousing was intheFrench temperament.
sentences.chinese: 近三分之一的人说法国人爱发牢骚是性情使然。

sentences.english: Is it me or does Dave Winer just whine too much?
sentences.chinese: 是我还是大卫维特牢骚太多？

definition: lit. belly full of complaints (idiom)/discontent/always moaning and complaining
to complain/to grumble/to harbor a complaint/to feel dissatisfied
long-winded/garrulous/to talk endlessly without getting to the point
to pay back a score/to get revenge/to requite/(old) variant of 抱怨[bao4 yuan4]
to catch fire/to ignite/to detonate/to get angry
to sound like a broken record/to prattle/to nag/to mutter
